lines.speaker: The Light
lines.text: I am old. Older than the stone you stand on. I was the first question anyone ever asked.

lines.speaker: The Light
lines.text: The crystal-maker's answer is: 'Things shouldn't change.' That is the only answer that would silence the question forever.

lines.speaker: The Light
lines.text: You will need to offer your own answer. Not with words. With memory.

lines.speaker: The First Dreamer
lines.text: The question was asked. You are the newest answer. Carry it well.

lines.speaker: Curator's Right Hand
lines.text: The Curator weeps for every battle. So do I. But these moments are worth protecting.

lines.speaker: Curator's Right Hand
lines.text: The Curator is below. They know you're coming. They've always known.

lines.speaker: Archive Keeper
lines.text: You do not understand what you are destroying. Each frozen moment is irreplaceable.
